title: Tesla Motors - The Car Company They're Scared Of And Why

comments.text:
My worst life experiences has been through car dealerships, if there is a 
hell it should be inside a dealership. I am rooting for TESLA. I have 
ridden a TESLA and its awesome. I hope they will be very successful in the 
future. ﻿
comments.author: Voshadhi Amarasinghe

comments.text: I am conservative and I agree with you, when it comes to this car.﻿
comments.author: Chandra Dunning

comments.text:
Too much republican bashing, yes, but keeping Tesla out of the market in 
any way is ridiculous. Crony oil is fighting tooth and nail to stay viable. 
We all know it's only a matter of time before electric everything is the 
norm. And Tesla autos and home solar/battery systems is going to help it 
happen. Note to you guys on the panel: Fox bashes the Democrats, you bash 
the Republicans. Lose/lose. It's a turn-off for both. And stop making 
gorilla noises, dude.﻿
comments.author: rockeraaj

comments.text:
I'm still wondering how this sort of stuff is not considered bribery or a 
breach of the principles of democracy.﻿
comments.author: Sean Pierce

comments.text: Dealers are merciless sharks waiting for ripoffs﻿
comments.author: Paul Ang

comments.text:
This is so wrong--this is how Politics are done, and is both Democratic and 
Republican but Liberals try to make themselves look good but it is both and 
always will be.  Both are corrupt, both are bribed thru lobbyist.  I just 
wish there were honest people that can admit this, but I quess this group 
has no common sense or they have a agenda like Politics.﻿

comments.text: Elon for president of the world....﻿

4:54 4:58 it's not as .... we temped to draw to that conclusion. Can

comments.author: Николай Каретников

comments.text:
The Young Jerks ignore all the democrat politicians who have been doing the 
same thing.  Its wrong no matter which party is doing it but if you think 
for a 1/2 second that the democrats are any better then you're drinking the 
kool-aid and should seriously diversify your news sources.  The democrats 
are in the pocket of the unions and everyone knows they don't want a car 
made by robots.  Wake the heck up people.﻿
comments.author: Doug Brown

comments.text:
We need to put Libertarians or some other party in office.  The two major 
parties suck.
comments.author: Gail Hill

comments.text: Typical bullshit coming from American politics...﻿
comments.author: Lt Surge

comments.text: your channel is shit...  get the hell off the youtubes﻿
comments.author: calholli

comments.text:
So many inconstancies and out right lies in this particular report I'm not 
sure where to start. First, Fox News has never bashed Tesla or their cars, 
period. Second, $100,000 doesn't go far in ANY state legislature. If I were 
to hazard a guess I would say that bought the legislation from the author 
and no one else. Third, crony capitalism? And only blaming Republicans? 
Please, if the dealership coalition wants to guarantee the legislature 
passes this POS legislation I s going to take both parties, even in 
republican heavy Ohio.
Oh, and the base price for the Tesla Roadster was $90,000. It jumped to 
$110,000 well after the start of production. 
Have no doubt Mr. Musk could afford to "buy" the Ohio state legislature 
much more easily than the Ohio State Dealership coalition. But what I 
believe he should do is put more showrooms in the surrounding states and 
sell to Ohioans and yell Ohio legislators to go fuck themselves because 
they just cost their state tax money﻿
comments.author: John Hegner

comments.text:
The dealers don't make much on a sale, they do however make a killing on 
after sale parts and service
And the manufacturers make their money on after warranty parts sales
Tesla doesn't want any part of that model
Best bud worked at service dept eight years for a Mercedes dealer, so take 
the info for what it's worth to you﻿
comments.author: CheekyMonkey888

comments.text:
+CheekyMonkey888  And since Tesla has fewer moving parts, it needs even 
less maintenance! It says a lot when no consumer is defending the 
"stealerships" because they provide a shitty service and Tesla's customer 
service rocks!
comments.author: Isaac Alonzo

comments.text: what you say is true,
comments.author: Jerry Walz

comments.text: I love Tesla!!!﻿
comments.author: EVDE KSP

comments.text:
How is this any different from what the big three did to Preston Tucker 
back in the day? And now with lower gas prices...

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tucker:_The_Man_and_His_Dream﻿
comments.author: Mike George

comments.text:
Goodbye, shady car dealers who have always been a pain in the butt to deal 
with and make ridiculous amounts off of consumers.  Good riddance.  Car 
dealers and/or manufacturers are pulling their hair out.  It couldn't make 
me happier to see them hurting.  People will just go to the states that 
allow Tesla sales.  Dealers have been screwing people for decades.  We are 
sick of it.  And used car salesman are the worst.﻿
comments.author: Cissy2cute

comments.text:
Germain motor cars, Ricart Automotive and Midwestern Auto Group (MAG) were 
the culprits of preventing Tesla from selling to Ohioans.
--No longer will that be the case; as there are now 3 separate Tesla 
showrooms a crossed the great state of Ohio. 
*the case went all the way to the State Supreme Court. ﻿
comments.author: John Sneddon

comments.text:
Most people hate going to a car dealership to buy a car........ People 
leave the dealer feeling that they have been taken advantage of... or even 
cheated.......
TESLA is customer centered and is up front about the cost.......RepubliCONS 
hate competition to the fossil fuel industry.......﻿
comments.author: Kenz300 x

comments.text:
The high prices help with raising the demand by making it unreachable for 
you. Then when they dangle the prices that you can afford you'll jump all 
over it.﻿
comments.author: marcus davenport

comments.text:
Did you know that Lincoln doesn't have any markup in their vehicles. There 
isn't much wiggle room. There are a few rebates and incentives that you can 
qualify for but those are directly from Lincoln. Very easy way to buy a 
car. Not to mention they are putting out the best vehicles right now with 
great deals on financing and leasing. Low money factors and no upcharge or 
incentives for 0% financing. They let you borrow their money for no cost. 
Very good way to do business!﻿
comments.author: marcus davenport

comments.text:
What is it about our system that makes it so hard to get our public 
officials to work for the rest of us as opposed to a few wealthy campaign 
contributors. How on earth can we separate these ideological prostitutes 
from their pimps. I fear that if we cannot find a way soon we'll pay dearly 
for our carelessness.﻿
comments.author: Gdwolf50

comments.text:
+Gdwolf50 Unless you are obscenely wealthy, it is impossible. Politicians 
will always go with the money! It's why they're politicians.

comments.text: And the plutocrats in charge of gutting campaign finance laws.

comments.text:
Tesla is fighting other automakers and the state loses money on that so

comments.text:
Volkswagen will take them down by 2020. They already make cars that get 
300mpg but banned from the USA because the world is convinced you can

comments.author: Friebe1000

comments.text:
They are right, Don't care for the republican bashing, but it is what it 
is. If you agree or disagree they are right. I've been following the car 
for a year or so now, I've talked to an owner of one, tho briefly and he 
told me the positives and the negatives of his Tesla car. Its a good car, 
it still has its limitations but for me and my wife it would be a great 
fit. NO Gas (cost), No Oil changes( cost), just brakes, tires, front end 
alignments from time to from normal wear and tear. In other word low 
maintenance after the front end cost that evens out in the long term with 
comparable cars. I'm in. I just need the $100.000.00 cash to buy outright, 
for the one I would want, and thats want is stopping me for ordering me one 
now. #teslamotors   #electriccar   #electriccarnews  ﻿

comments.author: Dion Markgraf (Dionsol)

comments.text:
+lasourisaboyante​ I'd bet that in 1960, many computer scientists would've 
thought that smartphones 1000x as powerful as their supercomputers were "so 
utterly ridiculous that only the most maleducated and fatuous would even 
give it a second glance." I'm just saying dude, you never know what new 
fields of physics might be discovered in the next 50 years. 150 years ago, 
the very idea of nuclear reactors, let alone thorium ones was ridiculous. 
You're right that its unlikely and impossible under today's laws of 
physics, but the thing about laws of physics is we keep discovering new 
ones. It isn't a patently ridiculous idea, its just one that is patently 
ridiculous with today's science.﻿ Yes, TYT has a ridiculous partisan bias 
and I act accordingly. I do largely ignore their political "coverage," and 
I know that Cenk is no scientist by any stretch of the word. But what is 
partisan about thorium cars? And why does bashing corrupt state legislators 
for protecting entrenched monopolies become meaningless if the person doing 
it is a liberal? Cenk is right, Ohio Republicans should be throwing the 
people out, and that they're not speaks volumes.
comments.author: Sean Kurth

comments.text:
I have just found out that there is an electric skateboard (Marble) made 
with Telsas battery technology for 1300$ ........... Ladys and 
gentlemen..... I have just entered heaven....
comments.author: David Mendoza

comments.text:
+Brunon Paul Bielinski And guess what? American companies *also* charge the 
price of a house, then give you a low-quality, inefficient deathtrap in 
return. Why should I pay $60k for a Cadillac that will be in the junkyard 
in 10 years, when the Japanese or Germans will sell me something more 
luxurious that will last twice as long and get better mileage for $10-20k 
less? Yes, Lexuses are rebadged Toyotas, so what? Cadillacs are rebadged 
Chevys.

Seriously, why should I? Patriotism? Well guess what, patriotism doesn't 
give me free money and even if it did, I wouldn't blow that money on an 
inefficient, overpriced deathtrap. But this Tesla, this is an American car 
company I can support. Tesla is doing everything the Japanese were doing in 
the 90s, and doing it 10x better. Tesla is the very embodiment of American 
innovation and proof of American exceptionalism. Its companies like Tesla 
and Apple and Google that have restored my faith that my country can be a 
world dominating force for good.

So you know what? I'm saving up that 100k, if it takes me until I'm 60 to 
do it I'll still do it, and I'm buying a Tesla, wherever it is legal to do 
so. And if that offends you, if the idea that an American company could 
make something that's actually efficient, safe and useful and I want to buy 
it makes me some sort of communist hippie liberal traitor, then you know 
what? Maybe you're the one whose unamerican, not me.
comments.author: Sean Kurth

comments.text:
You need to understand that TYT is not a reliable source.  They are so 
blinded by their partisanship that they fall for stupid scams all the time 
because those scams happen to fit their desired world view.  They simply do 
not have the education, or intelligence to be a credible source of 
information.  A great example is their coverage of the so called "thorium 
car."  Thorium is not a scam.  The proposal of this vehicle is an utter 
scam.  You going to have rolling nuclear reactors breeding the thorium to 
u232... And you are going to do the reprocessing to remove the undesired 
actinides when?  Where? Right?  And then convert the heat to what.. 
lasers?  To heat water to produce steam to drive a turbine to make 
electricity to drive the car?  Why?  This proposal is so utterly ridiculous 
that only the most maleducated and fatuous would even give it a second 
glance.  What fucking moron would convert the heat energy to electricity 
for lasers only to use the lasers to heat water to make steam to make 
electricity?  And what kind of fucking morons would even entertain such a 
stupid concept... Well we have the borderline retarded Cenk and Pretty 
Points (but my God I'd sooner stick my dick in a wood chipper)...   Perfect 
for TYT.  And connecting LFTR reactors (which are a very promising 
technology) to ridiculous childish fluff like the "thorium powered car" 
only exposes the REAL idea to ridicule.
comments.author: lasourisaboyante

comments.text:
+David Mendoza I just get tired of people falling for such utterly 
stupid frauds.  And tyt... to hold them up as luminaries of intellectualism 
is like serving turds and calling them brownies.
comments.author: lasourisaboyante

comments.text: +lasourisaboyante so much passion, I love it! Haha

comments.text:
Over the last few decades I have been dismayed as The Axis Powers car 
manufacturers have kept on increasing their car sales and the diminished

Trolls always litter these posts with coal nonsense.  Bonneville has more 
power coming over the dam than they can sell.  We have no need for  oil, 
gas, coal,and nuclear. Nikola Tesla himself said, "The sun gives us more 
power than we can ever use..everyday."  The only reason our planet is not 
powered by the sun is the coal, oil, gas and nuclear power industries do 
everything they can to prevent mass production of solar panels and electric 
cars.  Why?  GM's EV! obsoleted gas engine in 1999.  Koch Brothers 
"Chevron" bought the EV1 NiMH battery patents from GM.  GM recalled and 
buried the EV1 and its battery that ran the car 320 miles on a charge from 
the 110 outlet in your garage.  Koch Brothers then denied the batteries to 
electric car makers, meaning we are 15 years behind getting Co2 out of our 
atmosphere.  It is the gas engine that should be outlawed.  It is so 
obsolete and so dangerous.  Dangerous? Wrap your lips around your tailpipe 
and breathe deeply Ok, open the garage door.  We've been doing that for 
over 100 years.  The atmosphere is saturated.

Tesla, hydro, solar and wind.  What else do we need?﻿

comments.author: jorgekontor

comments.text:
Hi John,
 Good work, it is hard to put together a topic team show.  One business 
fact I did not hear in your show:  Car manufacturers use dealers as storage 
for inventory of cars.  When you want a model and equipment combination 
they can transfer the car from another's inventory.  This purchase of 
inventory plus the land costs, plus the inventory taxes are certainly an 
investment that car dealers have made in their businesses and would want to 
protect.  Did not hear the business side, only the 'picking on Tesla' side. 
 When Tesla grows, they will have inventory in dealers like everyone else. 
 Yes, it looks like the effort to squash them as a competitor and reduce 
their chance of getting a foothold.  
   Your point that Tesla is outselling BMW and Mercedes looked a bit 
improvisational, because you added no backup of facts or numbers. Later, 
your woman commentator said Tesla had a waiting list and could not fulfill 
orders, and the panel agreed.
 Third panelist from the left begins decrying 'crony capitalism' where 
people protect their interests,then by the end of the show he reverses 
entirely and advocates for Mr. Musk of Tesla to do exactly the same thing 
and boast about his wealth and attack lawmakers and other opponents.  
  60 minutes from CBS news once closed with a segment called 
"point-counterpoint". Two people, differing opinions and each person held 
to their opinion for the entire broadcast.  Then the audience can process 
the information.
  You have the makings of a good formula, but have your team come from a 
point of view, hold a perspective that we can learn from, or be consistent 
with measurable examples.  This would set you apart, and put you ahead.﻿

comments.text:
+Jerry Walz  67 percent of America's energy comes from fossil fuels. 
Nuclear, Hydropower, and geothermal energy account for less then  27 
percent of America's energy reserves and both have problems of their own. 
Hydro electric dams are expensive and apparently generate massive amounts 
of co2 from degrading biomass when first flooding their headponds. They 
also seriously impact fish species who live in the rivers where the dams 
are built.

A combination of Fracking and cheap natural gas has made nuclear power 
essentially unprofitable in America so it is very likely that in the mid to 
short term that percentage of American energy sources dependent on fossil 
fuels will only continue to rise. If nuclear power is to sustain our 
economy the industry needs massive investments which will come out of 
taxpayer pockets to modernize existing reactors, and make new reactors. 
There is also a substantial risk of a reactor meltdown or accident, anyone 
remember Three Mile Island, Fukashima, and Chernobyl?

comments.author: Vonar Roberts

comments.text:
+jl644 According to the EIA these are the primary sources that America got 
its energy from in 2013. 

Coal 39%
Natural Gas 27%
Nuclear 19%
Hydropower 7%
Other Renewable 6%
Biomass 1.48%
Geothermal 0.41%
Solar 0.23%
Wind 4.13%
Petroleum 1%
Other Gases < 1%

So nearly 40 percent of the power charging your "environmentally friendly" 
electric car is coming from dirty Coal fired power plants and a whole 0.23 
percent is coming from Solar power. How environmentally friendly is your 
lovely electric car now? Oh, right.... Not very.

comments.text:
The fact that they are blocking Tesla that happens to be a US company shows 
these so called government officials are corrupt hypocrites and dinosaurs.﻿
comments.author: Adrian Hetmanski

comments.text:
I own a Tesla.Yeah, Im never going back to gasoline cars. Makes no sense. 
Ive paid $4 to charge it since I have owned it. Going on 12 months now. 
Zero maintenance. I have women, men, kids.. all coming up to my car just to 
look at it. Just the other day, I walked out a store, a guy asked me about 
the cost of recharging it. I told him about the $4 since I've owned it. and 
@ 20 people who over heard it, all applauded. People want this but most 
just cant afford it. When the more affordable version comes out, big oil 
will really quake cause once switched, no one will go back. ﻿
comments.author: Ryan Benjamin
